Sanskrit Shlok: प्रजावता वचसा वह्निरासा च हुवे नि च सत्सीह देवैः । वेषि होत्रमुत पोत्रं यजत्र बोधि प्रयन्तर्जनितर्वसूनाम् ॥४॥ (Rig. Veda.1.76.4)
IAST format: prajāvatā vacasā vahnirāsā ca huve ni ca satsīha devaiḥ । veṣi hotramuta potraṁ yajatra bodhi prayantarjanitarvasūnām ॥4॥ (Rig. Veda.1.76.4)
meaning: Rig Veda mantras (1.76.4) describes Agni as one who takes the offerings of humans through his mouth (वह्निरासा), who purifys and blesses one with sons (progeny), wealth and knowledge, that Agni is invited along with other devatas

Sanskrit Shlok: यो अध्वरेषु शंतम ऋतावा होता तमू नमोभिरा कृणुध्वम् । अग्निर्यद्वेर्मर्ताय देवान्स चा बोधाति मनसा यजाति ॥२॥  (Rig. Veda.1.77.2)
IAST format: yo adhvareṣu śaṁtama r̥tāvā hotā tamū namobhirā kr̥ṇudhvam । agniryadvermartāya devānsa cā bodhāti manasā yajāti ॥2॥ (Rig. Veda.1.77.2)
meaning: Rig Veda mantras (1.77.1 to 5) describes the role of Agni as the होता || Hota, who invites the other devatas, who carries the yajna offerings of the mortals to the deities, knows the desires of men and helps in fulfilling them

Sanskrit Shlok: अभि त्वा गोतमा गिरा जातवेदो विचर्षणे | दयुम्नैरभि पर णोनुमः || (Rig. Sanskrit Shlok: होतारं विश्ववेदसं सं हि त्वा विश इन्धते । स आ वह पुरुहूत प्रचेतसो ऽग्ने देवाँ इह द्रवत् ॥ (Rig. Veda.1.44.7)
IAST format: hōtāraṁ viśvavēdasaṁ saṁ hi tvā viśa indhatē । sa ā vaha puruhūta pracētasō 'gnē dēvām̐ iha dravat ॥ (Rig. Veda.1.44.7)
meaning: Rig Veda mantra 1.44.7 describes Agni as one who is विश्ववेदस् intellectual, illuminated by many people in their hearts (who perform havan) and praised for bringing along other distinguished jnanapradayaka devatas so that we are bestowed with jnana

Sanskrit Shlok: जराबोध तद्विविड्ढि विशेविशे यज्ञियाय | स्तोमं रुद्राय दृशिकम् || (Rig. Veda. 1.27.10)
IAST format: jarābōdha tadviviḍḍhi viśēviśē yajñiyāya | stōmaṁ rudrāya dr̥śikam || (Rig. Veda. 1.27.10) Meaning : Agni similar to Rudra, is one who makes the enemies weep.
meaning: Rig Veda mantra (1.27.10), addresses Agni as similar to Rudra (who destroys the bad qualities).

Sanskrit Shlok: त्वमग्नेरुद्रो असुरो महो दिवस्त्वं शर्धो मारुतं पृक्ष ईशिषे | (Rig. Veda. 2.1.6)

IAST format: sa ēva puruṣaḥ prajāpatirabhavat | sa yaḥ sa puruṣaḥ prajāpatirabhavat - ayamēva saḥ yō'yamagniścīyatē || 5 kāṇḍikā
meaning: Shatapatabrahmana:  Ukhasambharana (6 Kanda) Prathama Adhyaya Prathama Brahmana (अथाग्निचित्याब्राह्मणम् Agnichitya brahmanam) (6.1.1.5 and 11)[12]

Sanskrit Shlok: सः' एषः सप्तभिः पुरुषैर्निपऩ्न एकः पुरुषः 'प्रजापतिः' विराट् अभूत् | एवं लिङ्गशरीराभिमानिहिरण्यगर्भकर्तृका विराडुत्पत्तिरुक्ता, तस्य विराजोऽग्निरूपतामाह - स यः पुरुषः इति | 'स प्रजापतिः' एव 'अयं चीयमानः अग्निः' इत्यर्थः || Saayana Bhashyam of 5 काण्डिका (Page no 63 of Reference ) अथ यो गर्भोऽन्तरासीत् - सोऽग्निरसृज्यत | स यदस्य सर्वस्याग्रमसृज्यत - तस्मादग्निः | अग्निर्हवै तमग्निरित्याचक्षते परोऽक्षम् | परोऽक्षकामा हि देवाः |.... 11 काण्डिका
IAST format: 'saḥ' ēṣaḥ saptabhiḥ puruṣairnipana ēkaḥ puruṣaḥ 'prajāpatiḥ' virāṭ abhūt | ēvaṁ liṅgaśarīrābhimānihiraṇyagarbhakartr̥kā virāḍutpattiruktā, tasya virājō'gnirūpatāmāha - sa yaḥ puruṣaḥ iti | 'sa prajāpatiḥ' ēva 'ayaṁ cīyamānaḥ agniḥ' ityarthaḥ || Saayana Bhashyam of 5 kāṇḍikā atha yō garbhō'ntarāsīt - sō'gnirasr̥jyata | sa yadasya sarvasyāgramasr̥jyata - tasmādagniḥ | agnirhavai tamagnirityācakṣatē parō'kṣam | parō'kṣakāmā hi dēvāḥ |.... 11 kāṇḍikā
meaning: Meaning : That Prajapati is identified as Agni, formed from seven lustrous persons. That Agni covers all expanse. Prajapati as the Srustikarta creates all the celestial beings and heavenly bodies such as Aakasha, nakshtras. He also creates Agni as the yajnika agni.

Sanskrit Shlok: ततः 'यः' जातगर्भः, 'सः' "अग्निः असृज्यत" तस्मात् सर्वस्य स्थूलप्रपञ्चस्य "अग्रम्" आदौ सृष्टत्वात् अग्निरित्युच्यते | तम् अग्रिम् इदानीन्तना अग्निनाम्ना व्यवहारं कुर्वन्ति | .... Saayana Bhashyam of 11 काण्डिका
IAST format: tataḥ 'yaḥ' jātagarbhaḥ, 'saḥ' "agniḥ asr̥jyata" tasmāt sarvasya sthūlaprapañcasya "agram" ādau sr̥ṣṭatvāt agnirityucyatē | tam agrim idānīntanā agnināmnā vyavahāraṁ kurvanti | .... Saayana Bhashyam of 11 kāṇḍikā
meaning: Summary : Agni is described here as the form of heat which is the root of all creation. He is created first and forms the base for all gross creation until the present time. Hence Agni is called अग्रिम् || Agrim (first)

Sanskrit Shlok: मेधायै मनसेऽग्नये स्वाहेति मेधया वै मनसाभिगच्छति यजेयेति तदस्येतदमुभयमात्मन्येव यन्मेधा च मनश्च ते अस्मिन्नेते उभे देवते आत्मन्याधीते || (Kanva Shata. Brah. 4.1.4.11)
IAST format: mēdhāyai manasē'gnayē svāhēti mēdhayā vai manasābhigacchati yajēyēti tadasyētadamubhayamātmanyēva yanmēdhā ca manaśca tē asminnētē ubhē dēvatē ātmanyādhītē || (Kanva Shata. Brah. 4.1.4.11)
meaning: Meaning : Yajamani chants " To wisdom, to mind, to Agni - Svaaha". He intends with his mind, " May I perform the yajna". These two - wisdom and mind are within himself. He meditates upon both these deities (intent) in his own mind.

Sanskrit Shlok: वायुरनिलममृतमथेदं भस्मान्तम् शरीरम् । ॐ क्रतो स्मर कृतम् स्मर क्रतो स्मर कृतम् स्मर ॥१७॥ (Isav. Upan. 17)
IAST format: vāyuranilamamr̥tamathedaṁ bhasmāntam śarīram ।oṁ krato smara kr̥tam smara krato smara kr̥tam smara ॥17॥ (Isav. Upan. 17)
meaning: In this Upanishad, the last two mantras, as given below are a prayer to Agni who is the divine witness to the actions of every life form

Sanskrit Shlok: अग्ने नय सुपथा राये अस्मान्विश्वानि देव वयुनानि विद्वान् । युयोध्यस्मज्जुहुराणमेनो भूयिष्ठां ते नम उक्तिं विधेम ॥१८॥ (Isav. Upan. 18)
IAST format: agne naya supathā rāye asmānviśvāni deva vayunāni vidvān ।yuyodhyasmajjuhurāṇameno bhūyiṣṭhāṁ te nama uktiṁ vidhema ॥18॥ (Isav. Upan. 18)
meaning: Summary : Let my vital force merge with the Immortal being or Hiranyagarbha and let the body be reduced to ashes, Om, O my mind (Fire is identified with the mind) remember your deeds. Let Agni, who knows all our deeds, lead us along the right path or the bright path of the Devas (Devayana path from where there is no return to mortality), remove from us all crooked sin

Sanskrit Shlok: तेऽग्निमब्रुवन् जातवेद एतद्विजानीहि किमेतद्यक्षमिति तथेति ॥ ३॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.3)
IAST format: te'gnimabruvan jātaveda etadvijānīhi kimetadyakṣamiti tatheti ॥ 3॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.3)
meaning: Summary: Upon seeing the illuminated form of the Yaksha (Brahman) all the celestial beings were amazed, so they chose the illumine form of devatas, Agni to approach Yaksha. They desirous of knowing It, instruct Agni "O Jataveda (omniscient), find out thoroughly about what this Yaksha is". Here Agni is considered as अग्रणीः or one who leads or takes everyone forward.[16]

Sanskrit Shlok: तदभ्यद्रवत्तमभ्यवदत् कोऽसीत्यग्निर्वा अहमस्मीत्यब्रवीज्जातवेदा वा अहमस्मीति ॥ ४॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.4)
IAST format: tadabhyadravattamabhyavadat ko'sītyagnirvā ahamasmītyabravījjātavedā vā ahamasmīti ॥ 4॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.4)
meaning: Summary : With great pride Agni announces "अहम अग्निः अस्मि, इति". I am that Agni that illumines the visible objects, showing his self-importance. Every shape and form of any particular object is visible form of me, जातवेदाः Jatavedas!

Sanskrit Shlok: तस्मिंस्त्वयि किं वीर्यमित्यपीदं सर्वं दहेयं यदिदं पृथिव्यामिति ॥५॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.5)
IAST format: tasmiṁstvayi kiṁ vīryamityapīdaṁ sarvaṁ daheyaṁ yadidaṁ pr̥thivyāmiti ॥5॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.5)
meaning: Summary : Hearing the conceited words of Agni, Yaksha questions him about his valour and capability. Agni replies saying - I can burn and destroy all the things on earth.[20]

Sanskrit Shlok: तस्मै तृणं निदधावेतद्दहेति तदुपप्रेयाय सर्वजवेन तन्न शशाक दग्धुम् । स तत एवनिववृते नैतदशकं विज्ञातुं यदेतद्यक्षमिति ॥ ६॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.6)
IAST format: tasmai tr̥ṇaṁ nidadhāvetaddaheti tadupapreyāya sarvajavena tanna śaśāka dagdhum । sa tata evanivavr̥te naitadaśakaṁ vijñātuṁ yadetadyakṣamiti ॥ 6॥ (Kena. Upan. 3.6)
meaning: Summary : Destroying the pride of Agni, Yaksha questions him if he can destroy the blade of grass placed before him which he could not destroy with his full force. Agreeing his inadequacy, Agni returns to the devatas claiming ignorance of the Brahman. Then he learns about the Parabrahma tattva

Sanskrit Shlok: स त्वमग्निं स्वर्ग्यमध्येषि मृत्यो, प्रब्रूहि त्वं श्रद्दधानाय मह्यम् । स्वर्गलोका अमृतत्वं भजन्त एतद् द्वितीयेन वृणे वरेण ॥ १३॥ (Kath. Upan. 1.1.13)
IAST format: sa tvamagniṁ svargyamadhyeṣi mr̥tyo, prabrūhi tvaṁ śraddadhānāya mahyam । svargalokā amr̥tatvaṁ bhajanta etad dvitīyena vr̥ṇe vareṇa ॥ 13॥ (Kath. Upan. 1.1.13)
meaning: Meaning : "Oh Mrityu, you know very well that Agni (sacred fire) is the means of attainment of heaven. Explain to me as I have asked you earnestly, by which the liberated souls attain immortality. This is the second boon I choose."[16]

Sanskrit Shlok: प्र ते ब्रवीमि तदु मे निबोध स्वर्ग्यमग्निं नचिकेतः प्रजानन् । अनन्तलोकाप्तिमथो प्रतिष्ठां विद्धि त्वमेतं निहितं गुहायाम् ॥ १४॥ (Kath. Upan. 1.1.14)
IAST format: pra te bravīmi tadu me nibodha svargyamagniṁ naciketaḥ prajānan । anantalokāptimatho pratiṣṭhāṁ viddhi tvametaṁ nihitaṁ guhāyām ॥ 14॥ (Kath. Upan. 1.1.14)
meaning: Yama replies " O Nachiketa! I know about the sacred fire and I shall explain it to you. Know that Agni is the means to attain all worlds and in it lies the greatness of the people performing vedic rites."

Sanskrit Shlok: लोकादिमग्निं तमुवाच तस्मै या इष्टका यावतीर्वा यथा वा । स चापि तत्प्रत्यवदद्यथोक्तं अथास्य मृत्युः पुनरेवाह तुष्टः ॥ १५॥ (Kath. Upan. 1.1.15)
IAST format: lokādimagniṁ tamuvāca tasmai yā iṣṭakā yāvatīrvā yathā vā । sa cāpi tatpratyavadadyathoktaṁ athāsya mr̥tyuḥ punarevāha tuṣṭaḥ ॥ 15॥ (Kath. Upan. 1.1.15)
meaning: Yama expounds to Nachiketa the secrets of Agni that leads to heaven and the number and mode of setting of fire bricks required to build the altar.

Sanskrit Shlok: स एतं देवयानं पन्थानमापद्याग्निलोकमागच्छतिस वायुलोकं स आदित्यलोकं (Kaus. Upan. 1.3)

Sanskrit Shlok: अथ हाग्नय: समूदिरे, तप्तो ब्रह्मचारी कुशलं न: पर्यचारीद्धन्तास्मै प्रब्रवामेति तस्मै होचु: ॥ ४ ॥ (Chan. Upan. 4.10.4)
IAST format: atha hāgnaya: samūdire, tapto brahmacārī kuśalaṁ na: paryacārīddhantāsmai prabravāmeti tasmai hocu: ॥ 4 ॥ (Chan. Upan. 4.10.4)
meaning: Meaning: The 3 fires then said among themselves: "this brahmachari has performed his penances and has tended us (fires) very well. let us teach him (about Brahman). " So saying they talk about breath and akasha and their being connected with brahman. Each fire (garhapatya, ahvaneeya and daakshina) explain to him about his own particular philosophy.

Sanskrit Shlok: अथ हैनं गार्हपत्योऽनु शशास  पृथिव्यग्निरन्नमादित्य इति य । एष आदित्ये पुरुषो दृश्यते सोऽहमस्मि स एवाहमस्मीति ॥ १ ॥ (Chan. Upan. 4.11.1)
IAST format: atha hainaṁ gārhapatyo'nu śaśāsa  pr̥thivyagnirannamāditya iti ya । eṣa āditye puruṣo dr̥śyate so'hamasmi sa evāhamasmīti ॥ 1 ॥ (Chan. Upan. 4.11.1)
meaning: Meaning : The gaarhapatya fire taught him " the earth, fire, food and sun - these are my four forms (bodies). And the person seen in the sun (personification) that I am, that I am indeed!". One who understands and meditates upon it, becomes invincible and lives a complete life.

Sanskrit Shlok: यदा लेलायते हृार्चि: समिद्धे हव्यवाहने | तदाज्यभागावन्तरेणाहुती: प्रतिपादयेत् || (Mund. Upan. 1.2.2)
IAST format: yadā lelāyate hr̥ārci: samiddhe havyavāhane | adājyabhāgāvantareṇāhutī: pratipādayet || (Mund. Upan. 1.2.2)
meaning: Meaning : When the flames of the bearer of the havisya offerings (fire) are bright and high, let the offerings (of yajnika ghee) be given, with faith, between the two (tongues) flares of the fire.

Sanskrit Shlok: यस्याग्निहोत्रमदर्शमपौर्णमासमचातुर्मास्यमनाग्रयणमतिथिवर्जितं च | अहुतमवैश्वदेवमविधिना हुतमाससप्तमां स्तस्य लोकान्हिनस्ति || (Mund. Upan. 1.2.3)
IAST format: yasyāgnihotramadarśamapaurṇamāsamacāturmāsyamanāgrayaṇamatithivarjitaṁ ca | ahutamavaiśvadevamavidhinā hutamāsasaptamāṁ stasya lokānhinasti || (Mund. Upan. 1.2.3)
meaning: One (householder) whose Agnihotra is devoid of the Darsa, Paurnamaasa Chaaturmasya (four autumnal observances) yajnas, is not attended by the Atithi (uninvited guest), is without Vaisvedeva (offerings to the animals and birds) or is not performed without proper procedures or not performed at all (that Agnihotra) will destroy the seven worlds (of the householder).[26]

Sanskrit Shlok: काली कराली च मनोजवा च सुलोहिता या च सुधूम्रवर्णा | स्फुलिङ्गिनीं विश्वरुची च देवी लेलायमाना इति सप्त जिह्वा: || (Mund. Upan. 1.2.4)
IAST format: kālī karālī ca manojavā ca sulohitā yā ca sudhūmravarṇā | sphuliṅginīṁ viśvarucī ca devī lelāyamānā iti sapta jihvā: || (Mund. Upan. 1.2.4)
meaning: Meaning : That Agni, devours with his seven tongues or flames namely Kālī (black), Karālī (terrible),Manojava (speedy as the mind), Sulohita (very red), Sudhumravarna (coloured like thick smoke'), Sphulingini (emitting sparks) and Vishwaruchi (having the fuel as the Sun)

Sanskrit Shlok: अग्निमीळे पुरोहितं यज्ञस्य देवमृत्विजम् । होतारं रत्नधातमम् ॥१
IAST format: agnimīḻe purohitaṁ yajñasya devamr̥tvijam । hotāraṁ ratnadhātamam ॥1
meaning: Summary : Agni, the chosen one as the minister of yajnas, is worthy to be praised for he brings along other deities with him (He is the bearer of yajnika offerings from the Yajamani or the Performer of the Yajna). Agni bestows his worshiper with boundless riches and wealth. Indeed greatly revered is Agni, the dispeller of darkness.

Sanskrit Shlok: अग्निः पूर्वेभिर्ऋषिभिरीड्यो नूतनैरुत । स देवाँ एह वक्षति ॥२
IAST format: agniḥ pūrvebhirr̥ṣibhirīḍyo nūtanairuta । sa devām̐ eha vakṣati ॥2

Sanskrit Shlok: अग्निना रयिमश्नवत् पोषमेव दिवेदिवे । यशसं वीरवत्तमम् ॥३
IAST format: agninā rayimaśnavat poṣameva divedive । yaśasaṁ vīravattamam ॥3

Sanskrit Shlok: अग्ने यं यज्ञमध्वरं विश्वत: परिभूरसि । स इद् देवेषु गच्छति ॥४
IAST format: agne yaṁ yajñamadhvaraṁ viśvata: paribhūrasi । sa id deveṣu gacchati ॥4

Sanskrit Shlok: अग्निर्होता कविक्रतुः सत्यश्चित्रश्रवस्तमः । देवो देवेभिरा गमत् ॥५
IAST format: agnirhotā kavikratuḥ satyaścitraśravastamaḥ । devo devebhirā gamat ॥5

Sanskrit Shlok: यदङ्ग दाशुषे त्वमग्ने भद्रं करिष्यसि । तवेत् तत् सत्यमङ्गिरः ॥६
IAST format: yadaṅga dāśuṣe tvamagne bhadraṁ kariṣyasi । tavet tat satyamaṅgiraḥ ॥6

Sanskrit Shlok: उप त्वाग्ने दिवेदिवे दोषावस्तर्धिया वयम् । नमो भरन्त एमसि ॥७
IAST format: upa tvāgne divedive doṣāvastardhiyā vayam । namo bharanta emasi ॥7

Sanskrit Shlok: राजन्तमध्वराणां गोपामृतस्य दीदिविम् । वर्धमानं स्वे दमे ॥८
IAST format: rājantamadhvarāṇāṁ gopāmr̥tasya dīdivim । vardhamānaṁ sve dame ॥8

Sanskrit Shlok: स न: पितेव सूनवे ऽग्ने सूपायनो भव । सचस्वा नः स्वस्तये ॥९
